text: right A Cannonball, also referred to as a Bomb, is a diving style where the diver hugs their knees and attempts to enter the water with their body shaped as much like a sphere as possible. The goal is to create a large splash. Known in German as the Arschbombe the cannonball has been turned into the competitive sport of "Splashdiving". In New Zealand referred to colloquially as a Manu in the indigenous Māori language. ==References== ==External links== * Cannonball photos at Getty Images * New Zealand Youtube video of Full-manu with baller Category:Diving (acrobatics)
title: Cannonball (diving)
